intro: Cipuropsis subandina, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in harsh climates. Cipuropsis subandina is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
